instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message:
It is <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Titile is wrong

No liquid damage as I see. It doesnot power. I tried 2 different AC adapter 60W and 85W
Green light is on. When press power button nothing happend.

<SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_REF3</SIGNAL> - 3.29V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.55V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> - 3V- 0V -3V when press power
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - missing always before and after power
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> - 3V - 0V - 3V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> - 0V before and after power
<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
Seems PCH doesnot respond. What I miss?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message: No need to press power button it auto powers on. Hook up the bare board and while connecting the magsafe keep an eye on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> on L7220. Also check all coils for short to GND

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message:
Well, when I say press power I mean short to ground <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and I always work with bare board. Yestarday last thing I did was put flux about PCH and heat it, but doesnot work.
Now, I just took the board to test and it power and video is ok. Dont know really what was wrong and if it will fail again very soon. Any idea what to do in this case?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message:
It power 5 times and now it doesnot power. But I noted something intersting. With fake 60w adapter green light is always on. I tried now and 5 times will not power and 1 time will power.
With original 60W adapter when I plug it I can observe 2 thing.
1. If green light is on constantly it will power and will have video
2. If green light is on but blinking, it will not power. It is blinking 90% on and 10% off, but easy to realize it is blinking. 

Hope with this you can tell me something more.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message: The green light should turn orange even without a battery connected. This must be liquid damage, inspect closely again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message:
Sorry, I was looking 2 board at time and this one is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, not retina I said in title.
I found something bwtween pin11 and 12 in <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>. I remove it and reflow it with flux and now it power. Do you think this coudl be the problem? <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message: As I see pin12 is <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC</SIGNAL> and PCH need 32khz to respond with S5 and S4. Sound logical to me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message: <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> is important but has nothing to do with getting a green light or not. Probably also corrosion under SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message: Now it works always and green light some times dissapear for 2,3 seconds, but laptop keeping on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina
threads.message: I still say crap under SMC. But try another magsafe board and Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> stays high when green light goes off.
